labels.name: Alpha
labels.description: These signals have been tested and reviewed internally for syntax. Little or no testing of expected alert generation has been conducted. These signals are not included on the external feed.

labels.name: Beta
labels.description: These signals have been tested and reviewed internally for syntax. Internal testing of expected alert generation has been verified. Testing on internal systems for false positives has been conducted and tuned if necessary. These signals are included on the external feed.

labels.name: Stable
labels.description: These are vetted signals that have been tested and used at scale. Large amounts of false positives are not expected. These signals are included on the external feed.

labels.name: Test
labels.description: These signals have just been added without testing or review. No guarantees are made as to their state. These signals are not included on the external feed.

labels.name: Linux
labels.description: These signals are built for Linux based hosts.

labels.name: Windows
labels.description: These signals are built for Windows hosts.

labels.name: Mac
labels.description: These signals are built for Mac OS hosts.

signals.name: AMSI and Script Block Evasion
signals.description: Detects techniques used to bypass Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and Script Block Logging.
signals.text: image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation' AND (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.AmsiUtils' AND (process.command_line contains 'amsiSession' OR process.command_line contains 'amsiContext' OR process.command_line contains 'amsiInitFailed')) OR (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.Utils' AND process.command_line contains 'cachedGroupPolicySettings' AND registry.key_path contains 'EnableScriptBlockLogging') OR (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock' AND process.command_line contains 'signatures' AND process.command_line contains 'System.Collections.Generic.HashSet')

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

signals.name: AWK Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with awk.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'awk' AND process.command_line contains 'inet' and process.command_line contains 'tcp' AND process.command_line contains 'while' AND process.command_line contains 'printf' AND process.command_line contains 'getline' AND process.command_line contains 'break' AND process.command_line contains 'close'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Administrator Account Enumeration
signals.description: Detects usage of the NET.EXE or DSQuery.exe  utility to enumerate members of the local Administrators or Domain Administrators groups. Often used during post-compromise reconnaissance.
signals.text: (((process.command_line contains 'group' AND process.command_line contains 'Domain' AND process.command_line contains 'Admins') OR (process.command_line contains 'localgroup' AND process.command_line contains 'Administrators') OR (process.command_line contains 'Exchange' AND process.command_line contains 'Trusted' AND process.command_line contains 'Subsystem')) AND process.path ends with '\\net.exe' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist' AND process.command_line contains NOT '/add') OR (process.command_line contains 'Admin' AND process.path ends with '\\dsquery.exe')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Administrator Account Enumeration - Spanish
signals.description: Detecta el uso de la herramienta net.exe para enumerar miembros del grupo administradores locales. Frecuentemente usado para propositos de reconocimiento despues del compromiso inicial.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'net.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/add' AND process.command_line contains 'localgroup administradores' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows ccmcache'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: AppInstaller File Download
signals.description: Detects the use of the Windows native utility AppInstaller.exe to download a file.
signals.text: process.path contains 'appinstaller' AND process.command_line contains 'source' AND process.command_line contains 'url'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: At Scheduled Tasks Persistence
signals.description: Detects the use of at.exe to schedule a task every given interval. This is a known living off the land attacker technique.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\at.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'every'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: BITSADMIN File Retrieval and Execution
signals.description: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a built-in Windows utility that can be used to download and execute files, as well as upload files, to a URL. Direct execution of the BITSADMIN utility is uncommon, and may be abused to retrieve and run malware or transfer other files. Recurrent BITS jobs can also be used as a persistence mechanism.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\bitsadmin.exe' AND ((process.command_line contains 'http' AND (process.command_line contains '/AddFile' OR process.command_line contains '/transfer')) OR ((process.command_line contains '/SetNotifyCmdLine' AND process.command_line contains '/AddFile') OR process.command_line contains '/setproxysettings')) AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\DSS'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Base64 Commands Exfil
signals.description: Detects common commands used to exfiltrate data encoded with base64 over TCP.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'ssh' AND process.command_line contains 'ssh' AND process.command_line contains 'base64' AND process.command_line contains '>' AND file.path ends with 'tty'

Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Base64 Encoded DNS Query
signals.description: Detects DNS queries that contain a double equals which base64 uses for padding when encoding a string.
signals.text: network.dns_query contains '=='

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted/Obfuscated Non-C2 Protocol

signals.name: Bash Commands Download via HTTP GET Request
signals.description: Detects the use of Bash via an HTTP GET request to download potentially suspect content.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'bash' AND process.command_line contains 'bash' AND process.command_line contains 'echo -ne' AND process.command_line contains 'HTTP' AND process.command_line contains 'dev' AND process.command_line contains 'tcp' AND process.command_line contains 'while' AND process.command_line contains 'read' AND process.command_line contains 'break' AND process.command_line contains 'done'
signals.id: Bash Commands Download via HTTP GET request

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Bash Commands Exfil
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a shell for exfiltration of data with bash.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'bash' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'echo' AND process.command_line contains '-e' AND process.command_line contains 'POST' AND process.command_line contains 'HTTP' AND process.command_line contains 'dev' AND process.command_line contains 'tcp'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Bcdedit Boot Status Ignore Failures
signals.description: Detects usage of bcdedit.exe to ignore all failures on boot. This can be used by ransomware to eliminate recovery options.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\bcdedit.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'set' AND process.command_line contains 'default' AND process.command_line contains 'bootstatuspolicy' AND process.command_line contains 'ignoreallfailures'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Bcdedit Boot into Safe Mode
signals.description: Detects usage of bcdedit.exe to force the computer to boot into safemode during the next boot. This has been seen used by ransomware as a technique to avoid security software preventions.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\bcdedit.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'set' AND process.command_line contains 'current' AND process.command_line contains 'safeboot'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Bcdedit Disabling Recovery
signals.description: Detects usage of bcdedit.exe to disable recovery from boot configuration data. This can be used by ransomware to eliminate recovery options.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\bcdedit.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'set' AND process.command_line contains 'default' AND process.command_line contains 'recoveryenabled' AND process.command_line contains 'no'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Binary Created by C# Command Line Compiler
signals.description: Detects the use of C# Command-Line Compiler (csc.exe) to compile a binary or library on a system. This can be used by attackers to create a binary in memory when wrapped in a cradle or to compile attacker binaries on disk before execution.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\csc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'nologo' AND process.command_line contains 'target'
signals.id: Binary Created by C# Command Line Compiler

techniques.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Compile After Delivery
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: BootCFG Boot into Safe Mode
signals.description: Detects usage of bootcfg.exe to force the computer to boot into safemode during the next boot. This has been seen used by ransomware as a technique to avoid security software preventions.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\bootcfg.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/raw' AND process.command_line contains 'safeboot' And process.command_line contains '/a'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Browser Created HTA or PS1 Files
signals.description: Detects the creation of HTA or powershell script files that are commonly created when visiting malicious domains.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'iexplore.exe' OR process.path ends with 'firefox.exe' OR process.path ends with 'browser_broker.exe' OR process.path ends with 'chrome.exe') AND group((file.operation is 'create' OR file.operation is 'rename') AND (file.path ends with '.hta' OR file.path ends with '.ps1') AND file.path contains NOT '\\windows\\temp\\__PSSscriptPolicy')
signals.id: Browser Created HTA or PS1 Files

signals.name: Bypass User Account Control
signals.description: The user account control (UAC) requires user interaction to escalate a process to a higher privilege, using bypasses such as sdclt.exe an attacker can escalate his processes privilege on a system.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'sdclt.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'kickoff') OR (((process.command_line contains 'reg.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'add') OR (process.command_line contains 'new-item' AND process.command_line contains 'set-item')) AND process.command_line contains '\\cmd.exe')

signals.text: process.parent_path ends with '\\fodhelper.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\System32\\svchost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\SysWOW64\\svchost.exe'

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Bypass User Account Control

signals.name: Chmod Set SGID Bit 2
signals.description: Detects when chmod is used to set the SGID bit which can be used to execute a process in the context of the group who owns a file, not the user who is executing the file. Attackers can use this technique to maintain root access on an endpoint.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'chmod' AND process.command_line contains ' 2' AND (process.ancestry_command_line contains NOT ' configure ' OR process.ancestry_command_line contains NOT '/dpkg/')

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Chmod Set SUID Bit u+s

Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Chrome Modifying Files in Windows Directory
signals.description: Detects Chrome or a descendent process modifying files in the windows directory, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\chrome.exe' AND group(file.path contains ':\\windows' AND file.path contains NOT 'tzres.dll' AND file.path contains NOT 'ole32.dll' AND file.path contains NOT 'CRYPTBASE.DLL' AND file.path contains NOT 'WINMMBASE.dll')
signals.id: Chrome Modifying Files in Windows Directory

signals.name: Chrome Spawned CMD
signals.description: Detects when the Chrome browser spawns a descendant cmd.exe process. This can be a sign of an attacker injection.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe' AND process.ancestry_path ends with '\\chrome.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Chrome Spawned PWSH
signals.description: Detects when the Chrome browser spawns a descendant pwsh.exe process. This can be a sign of an attacker injection.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe' AND process.ancestry_path ends with '\\chrome.exe'

signals.name: Chrome Spawned PowerShell
signals.description: Detects when the Chrome browser spawns a descendant powershell.exe process. This can be a sign of an attacker injection.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' AND process.ancestry_path ends with '\\chrome.exe'

signals.name: Chrome Using SOCKS Proxy Tunneling via Command Line
signals.description: Detects when Google Chrome is using the custom SOCKs proxy command-line option.  This Chrome feature can be utilized by attackers for activities such as SSH tunneling or accessing internal network services.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\chrome.exe' AND process.command_line contains '--proxy-server' AND process.command_line contains 'socks5://127.0.0.1:'
signals.id: Chrome Using SOCKS Proxy Tunneling via Command Line

signals.name: CimProvider DLL Injection
signals.description: Running CimProvider can be used by attackers to execute malicious code while bypassing security controls on systems.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\register-cimprovider.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'path'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: CmdKey Cached Credential Discovery
signals.description: Detects the use of cmdkey.exe to list cached credentials on a system. This is a known living off the land attacker technique.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\cmdkey.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'list'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Code Execution via Windows Update Client
signals.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client to execute a DLL.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\wuauclt.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'UpdateDeploymentProvider' AND process.command_line contains 'RunHandlerComServer' AND process.command_line contains NOT 'wuaueng.dll' AND process.command_line contains NOT 'UpdateDeploymentProvider.dll'
signals.id: Code Execution via Windows Update Client

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Command Processor AutoRun Persistence
signals.description: Detects when a AutoRun key for the command processor is set which can be used by attackers for persistence when the /D flag is not added to a command.
signals.text: registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\Command Processor\\AutoRun'

signals.name: Command Quoted Directory Traversal Execution
signals.description: Quoted strings containing dot dot slash in the command are parsed incorrectly allowing for directory traversal. This allows attackers to add characters to throw off detections or access executables in unexpected ways.
signals.text: process.command_line contains '/../'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Command Shell Launched by Office Applications
signals.description: Detects the execution of PowerShell or native command prompt by an Office application. May indicate document-based attacks.
signals.text: (process.parent_path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\excel.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\outlook.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\powerpnt.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\onenote.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\mspub.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\msaccess.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\lync.exe') AND (process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe')
signals.id: Command Shell Launched by Office Applications

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Common Language Runtime Image Load
signals.description: Detects the use of Common Language Runtime (CLR) by loading clr.dll or mscorwks.dll into uncommon processes. This is a common sign of malicious code execution in a legitimate processes runspace such as done by SharpPack.dll and other .NET reflection techniques used to avoid AppLocker and other whitelisting tools.
signals.text: (image.path ends with '\\clr.dll' OR image.path ends with '\\mscorwks.dll') AND (process.path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\excel.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powerpnt.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\chrome.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\firefox.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\iexplore.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\edge.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\lsass.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\explorer.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\services.exe' OR (process.path ends with '\\svchost.exe' AND process.command_line contains NOT '-k localsystemnetworkrestricted'))

signals.name: Compiled Help (CHM) Command Execution
signals.description: Detects the use of Windows HTML Help (HH.EXE) to execute commands embedded within CHM files.
signals.text: process.parent_path ends with '\\hh.exe' AND process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/c'

techniques.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution: Compiled HTML File
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.description: Enables Conhost to be able to run from the command line followed by an executable, which spawns it as a child process. Attackers can use this feature to perform indirect execution to evade some detection mechanisms.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Control Panel Items
signals.description: Control panel items can be used to execute arbitrary code and is a well known bypass mechanism for red teams and attackers.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\rundll32.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'Control' AND process.command_line contains 'RunDLL') OR (file.path ends with '.cpl' AND (registry.key_path contains 'CurrentVersion\\Control Panel\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\ControlPanel\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\Control Folder\\') AND process.path ends with NOT 'OfficeClickToRun.exe')

Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Credential Leak Manipulation
signals.description: Detects changes to the TokeanLeakDetectDelaySecs setting. This setting can be used to cause credentials from logged off users to leak and persist in memory until the endpoint is rebooted. The is an attacker technique to allow for credentials to persist in memory for later capture.
signals.text: registry.value_name is 'TokenLeakDetectDelaySecs'

signals.name: Curl Commands Exfil Port 443

signals.name: NET CLR Artifact Regsvr32
signals.description: Detects potential artifacts of CSharp injection that can be utilized by attackers with tools such as sharpshooter.
signals.text: group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '\\UsageLogs\\regsvr32.exe.log')

signals.name: Netsh Helper DLL
signals.description: Detects the creation of a Netsh helper binary that attackers can use for persistence and execution of malicious code.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'add' AND process.command_line contains 'helper'

techniques.name: Event Triggered Execution: Netsh Helper DLL
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Netsh Network Traffic Capture
signals.description: Enables netsh to be used to capture a network trace on a host. This can be used by attackers to monitor for passwords or other data of interest being transmitted over the wire.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'start' AND process.command_line contains 'trace'

signals.name: Netsh Port Forwarding
signals.description: Detects the use of netsh.exe used for port forwarding. This can allow attackers to tunnel interactions on jump boxes.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'l=' AND process.command_line contains 'listna' AND process.command_line contains 'connectp' AND process.command_line contains 'c='

signals.name: Netsh WLAN Discovery
signals.description: Detects the use of netsh.exe to create a wireless network report. An attacker can use this technique to discover what networks are available.
signals.text: process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\m_agent_service.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'show' AND process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'wlan'

signals.name: Netsh Wifi Credentials Harvesting
signals.description: Detect potential harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'wlan' AND process.command_line contains '=clear'

signals.name: Nltest Discovery
signals.description: Nltest can be used by an attacker to discover details of an environments domains, trusts, systems, and configurations.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\nltest.exe' AND (process.command_line contains 'domain_trusts' OR process.command_line contains 'dclist' OR process.command_line contains 'dsgetdc' OR process.command_line contains 'parentdomain')

signals.name: Nltest Execution
signals.description: Nltest can be used by an attacker as a means to retrieve the NetNTLM Hash.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'nltest.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/server:' AND process.command_line contains '/query'

signals.name: Node Capabilities Privilege Escalation
signals.description: Detects node commands to escalate privileges by making arbitrary manipulations of process UIDs.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'node' AND process.command_line contains 'process.setuid' AND process.command_line contains 'require' AND process.command_line contains 'child_process' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'sh' AND process.command_line contains 'stdio'

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Node Commands Bind Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a bind shell with node.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'node' AND process.command_line contains '-e' AND process.command_line contains '=' AND process.command_line contains 'child_process' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'createServer' AND process.command_line contains 'client.pipe' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stdin' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stderr' AND process.command_line contains 'listen' AND process.command_line contains 'process.env'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Node Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with node.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'node' AND process.command_line contains '-e' AND process.command_line contains '=' AND process.command_line contains 'child_process' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'net.connect' AND process.command_line contains 'process.env' AND process.command_line contains 'function' AND process.command_line contains 'this.pipe' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stdout' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stderr'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Non Break Space Character
signals.description: Detects the use of a non break space characters in a filename or command line. This can be used to make files appear to be named or in the same directory as legitimate files.
signals.text: process.path contains '\xc2\xa0' OR process.command_line contains '\xc2\xa0' OR file.path contains '\xc2\xa0'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Non Smss Spawned SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session
signals.description: Detects the potential misuse of a SQL client tools PowerShell session where smss is not the parent. This is a known attacker living off the land technique.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'ps.exe' AND process.path contains '\\sql' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\smss.exe'
signals.id: Non Smss Spawned SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session

signals.name: Odbconf DLL Execution via DLLRegisterServer
signals.description: This detects the use of the odbcconf.exe to self register a dll via DLLRegisterServer for execution.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\Odbcconf.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/a' AND process.command_line contains 'REGSVR'

signals.name: Odbconf DLL Execution via RSP File
signals.description: This signal detects the use of the odbcconf.exe to self register a DLL via a RSP file for execution.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\Odbcconf.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-f' AND process.command_line contains 'rsp'
signals.id: Odbconf DLL Execution via RSP File

signals.name: Office Applications Executing AppData Binaries
signals.description: Detects the execution of binaries by office applications in a users AppData directory which is a common staging directory.
signals.text: (process.parent_path contains 'winword.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'excel.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'outlook.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'powerpnt.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'onenote.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'mspub.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'msaccess.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'lync.exe') AND (process.path contains '\\AppData') AND process.path ends with NOT '\\filecoauth.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\firefox.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\chrome.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\OneDrive.exe'

signals.name: OpenSSL Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with OpenSSL.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'openssl' AND process.command_line contains 's_client' AND process.command_line contains 'quiet' AND process.command_line contains 'connect'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: PHP Commands Download
signals.description: Detects the use of PHP to download potentially suspect content.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'php' AND process.command_line contains '-r' AND process.command_line contains 'file_get_contents' AND process.command_line contains 'getenv' AND process.command_line contains 'file_put_contents'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: PHP Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with php.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'php' AND process.command_line contains '-r' AND process.command_line contains 'fsockopen' AND process.command_line contains 'exec' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: PHP Shell Break Out
signals.description: Detects PHP shell break out from a restricted shell by spawning an interactive shell.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: PWSH Clear History

signals.name: PWSH Exclusion Added to Defender
signals.description: Detects the use of PowerShell to add a Microsoft Defender exclusion that attackers can use to avoid detections of malicious activity.

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

signals.name: Password Values in Registry
signals.description: Detects the modification of registry values named "password" that can contain vulnerable credentials.

signals.name: Perl CPAN Commands Reverse Shell

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with perl.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Perl Privilege Escalation
signals.description: Detects common commands used to escalate privileges with perl.

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Persistence using Office Templates and Trusts
signals.description: Detects various office template techniques used to execute a binary via persistence. These are commonly seen in association with persisting in VDI environments.
signals.text: group(file.path contains '\\appdata\\' AND file.operation is 'create' AND (file.path ends with '.wll' OR file.path ends with '.xll' OR file.path ends with '.ppa' OR file.path ends with '.ppam')) OR (group((registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\Office\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\VBA\\VBE\\') AND registry.key_path contains '\\Addins\\') AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.dll') AND process.path ends with NOT 'OfficeClickToRun.exe') OR (process.path contains 'regasm.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/codebase' AND process.command_line contains '.dll') OR (process.path contains 'VSTOInstaller.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/i' AND process.command_line contains '.vsto')
signals.id: Persistence using Office Templates and Trusts

techniques.name: Office Application Startup: Office Template Macros
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Persistence via Certificate Store Provider
signals.description: Detects usage of certificate store providers to execute a binary that can be used for persistence.
signals.text: group(registry.key_path contains 'Cryptography\\OID\\EncodingType 0\\CertDllOpenStoreProv' OR registry.key_path contains 'Microsoft\\SystemCertificates\\CA\\PhysicalStores')

signals.name: Persistence via Office Application Startup
signals.description: The Microsoft Office "Office Test" Registry Key may be leveraged by adversaries to load a DLL during launch of an Office Application.
signals.text: registry.key_path contains 'Software\\Microsoft\\Office test\\Special\\Perf'

signals.name: Pktmon Full Packet Capture
signals.description: Enables Pktmon to be used to get a full packet capture on a host with the -p 0 setting when starting the capture. This can be used by attackers to monitor for passwords or other data of interest being transmitted over the wire.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\pktmon.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'start' AND process.command_line contains 'etw' AND process.command_line contains 'p' AND process.command_line contains '0'

signals.name: Possible Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) Bypass Attempt
signals.description: Detects processes executed from user directories that attempt to drop an AMSI (Microsoft Anti-Malware Scan Interface) DLL. This technique is used by several PowerShell-based attack tools.
signals.text: group(file.path ends with '\\amsi.dll' AND file.operation is 'create') AND process.path contains '\\Users\\'
signals.id: Possible Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) Bypass Attempt

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

signals.name: PowerShell Audio Capture
signals.description: Detects the use of powershell to capture audio on a Windows system.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with 'pwsh.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'WindowsAudioDevice-Powershell-Cmdlet'

signals.name: PowerShell Clear History
signals.description: Detects the use of the clear-history in a powershell command line.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'clear-history'

signals.name: PowerShell Exclusion Added to Defender
signals.description: Detects the use of PowerShell to add a Microsoft Defender exclusion that attackers can use to avoid detections of malicious activity.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'Add-MpPreference' AND process.command_line contains '-ExclusionPath'

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

signals.name: PowerShell Prompted For User Credentials
signals.description: Detects the DLL loaded by a process when PowerShell is used to prompt the user for their credentials. Malware can use this technique to capture user credentials.
signals.text: image.path contains 'credui.dll' AND image.path contains 'wincredui.dll' AND image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation'

signals.name: PowerShell Using PowerCat
signals.description: This detects a PowerShell command that contains powercat, which is a PowerShell implementation of net cat. This tool is commonly used by attackers for remote shell access.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'powercat' AND image.path contains 'system.management.automation'

signals.name: PowerShell Using System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient
signals.description: This detects a PowerShell command containing System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient which can be used for remote command and control activity.
signals.text: image.path contains 'system.management.automation' AND process.command_line contains 'New-Object' AND process.command_line contains 'System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient'

signals.name: PowerUp DLL Hijacking Attempt
signals.description: Detect default behavior of the Write-HijackableDll payload in the PowerShell PowerUp utility.
signals.text: group(file.path ends with '\\debug.bat' AND file.operation is 'create') AND group(file.path ends with '\\wlbsctrl.dll' AND file.operation is 'create') AND process.path ends with NOT '\\explorer.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\dllhost.exe'

signals.name: Powershell Images Loaded by installutil.exe
signals.description: Detects the loading of Powershell libraries by installutil.
signals.text: process.path contains '\\installutil.exe' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Security.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Diagnostics.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Management.ni.dll'

signals.name: Powershell Images Loaded by regasm.exe
signals.description: Detects the loading of Powershell libraries by regasm.
signals.text: process.path contains '\\regasm.exe' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Security.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Diagnostics.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Management.ni.dll'

signals.name: Powershell Images Loaded by regsvcs.exe
signals.description: Detects the loading of Powershell libraries by regsvcs.

signals.name: Powershell Images Loaded by regsvr32.exe
signals.description: Detects the loading of Powershell libraries by regsvr32.

signals.name: Powershell Images Loaded by rundll32.exe
signals.description: Detects the loading of Powershell libraries by rundll32.
signals.text: process.path contains '\\rundll32.exe' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Security.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Diagnostics.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost.ni.dll' AND image.path contains 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Management.ni.dll'

signals.name: Privilege Escalation via apt update Option
signals.description: Detects use of Apt which can be leveraged to escalate privileges as it usually must be run via sudo. A user authorized to run apt as sudo can get an arbitrary elevated shell.

signals.name: Privilege Escalation via apt-get update Option

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: ProcDump Execution
signals.description: Detects the execution of the tool ProcDump used for capturing the contents of a processes memory into a file. This is commonly used by attackers to image lsass memory that contains credentials as well as other processes memory that contains sensitive data of value.
signals.text: registry.key_path contains 'Sysinternals\\ProcDump' AND process.command_line contains 'accepteula'

signals.name: Program Compatibility Assistant (PCALUA.EXE) Misuse
signals.description: Detects attempts to abuse the Windows Program Compatibility Assistant to execute malicious code based on suspicious command lines or paths.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\pcalua.exe' AND process.command_line contains ' -a ' AND (process.command_line contains '%TEMP%' OR process.command_line contains '\\\\' OR process.command_line contains '.LNK') OR (process.parent_path ends with '\\pcalua.exe' AND process.parent_command_line contains '-a ' AND (process.parent_command_line contains '%TEMP%' OR process.parent_command_line contains '\\\\' OR process.parent_command_line contains '.LNK'))

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Putty Spawning Suspicious Children
signals.description: This signal looks for common putty processes spawning child processes that are not putty.exe

signals.name: Python Commands Download
signals.description: Detects the use of python to download potentially suspect content.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'os' AND process.command_line contains 'environ' AND process.command_line contains 'sys.version_info.major' AND process.command_line contains 'urllib' AND process.command_line contains 'urlretrieve'

signals.name: Python Commands Exfil
signals.description: Detects the potential use of python to exfiltrate data.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'os' AND process.command_line contains 'sys.version_info.major' AND ( ( process.command_line contains 'urllib' AND process.command_line contains 'urlopen' AND process.command_line contains 'bytes' AND process.command_line contains 'urlencode' AND process.command_line contains 'read' ) OR ( process.command_line contains 'http.server' AND process.command_line contains 'socketserver' AND process.command_line contains 'SimpleHTTPServer' AND process.command_line contains 'TCPServer' AND process.command_line contains 'SimpleHTTPRequestHandler' AND process.command_line contains 'serve_forever' ) )

signals.name: Python Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with python.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'socket' AND process.command_line contains 'dup2' AND process.command_line contains 'fileno' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

signals.name: Python Load Shared Libraries
signals.description: Detects the use of python to load a library for execution.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'from ctypes' AND process.command_line contains 'import cdll' AND process.command_line contains 'cdll.LoadLibrary'

signals.name: Python Privilege Escalation
signals.description: Detects common commands used to escalate privileges with python.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains 'import os' AND process.command_line contains 'os.setuid' AND process.command_line contains 'os.system' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid

signals.name: Python SimpleHTTPRequestHandler Exfil

signals.name: RDP Enabled via Registry Modification
signals.description: Detects the enablement of RDP on a system via modification of the property values of the fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication keys.
signals.text: registry.key_path contains 'CurrentControlSet\\Control\\Terminal Server\\WinStations\\Rdp-Tcp' OR registry.key_path contains 'CurrentControlSet\\Control\\Terminal Server\\fDenyTSConnections'

signals.name: RDP Tunneling
signals.description: Detects potential configuration of RDP to listen on a system for connections. This technique can be used by attackers to bypasses network restrictions by tunneling malicious connections.
signals.text: group(network.port is '3389' AND (network.address starts with '127.0.' OR network.address is '::1'))

signals.name: RDP Tunneling with Chisel
signals.description: Chisel is a network tunneling tool that can be used to create encrypted channels into internal network environments, such as to perform RDP tunnelling. Chisel can transmit TCP over HTTP and encrypt the communication via SSH in order to evade firewall rules and deep packet inspection.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'client' AND process.command_line contains 'R:' AND process.command_line contains ':3389'

signals.name: RDP Tunneling with Fast Reverse Proxy
signals.description: Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) is a networking tool that can be used to expose firewalled or NAT’d network IPs to the Internet. It supports TCP and UDP, as well as HTTP and HTTPS protocols.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\frpc.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains '.ini' AND network.port is '3389'
signals.id: RDP Tunneling with Fast Reverse Proxy

signals.name: RDP Tunneling with plink
signals.description: A common utility used to tunnel RDP sessions is PuTTY Link, commonly known as Plink. Plink can be used to establish SSH network connections to other systems using arbitrary source and destination ports. Since many IT environments either do not perform protocol inspection or do not block SSH communications outbound from their network, attackers such as FIN8 have used Plink to create encrypted tunnels that allow RDP ports on infected systems to communicate back to the attacker command and control (C2) server.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\plink.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-P' AND process.command_line contains '-T' AND process.command_line contains '-N' AND process.command_line contains '-C' AND process.command_line contains '-R' AND process.command_line contains ':3389'

signals.name: REGSVR32 Script Component Runtime Misuse
signals.description: Detects the use of regsvr32 to download content from a malicious URL and invoke the Microsoft Script Component Runtime (scrobj.dll) module to execute the code.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'regsvr32.exe' AND (((process.command_line contains 'http:' OR process.command_line contains 'https:') AND process.command_line contains 'scrobj.dll') OR (process.command_line contains 'i:' AND process.command_line contains 'rs64'))

signals.text: process.command_line contains 'socat' AND process.command_line contains 'UNIX-LISTEN' AND process.command_line contains 'reuseaddr' AND process.command_line contains 'fork' AND process.command_line contains 'PROXY'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Socat SCTP Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands that are used to create an SCTP shell with socat.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'socat' AND process.command_line contains 'SCTP-Listen' AND process.command_line contains 'fork' AND process.command_line contains 'EXEC' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Socat SSH SOCKS5 Proxy Tunnel
signals.description: Detects common commands that are used to ssh through a socks5 proxy tunnel using socat.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'ssh' AND process.command_line contains 'socat' AND process.command_line contains 'ProxyCommand' AND process.command_line contains 'socksport'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Socat TCP Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands that are used to create an TCP shell with socat.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'socat' AND process.command_line contains 'TCP4-Listen' AND process.command_line contains 'fork' AND process.command_line contains 'EXEC' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Socat UDP Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands that are used to create a UDP shell with socat.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'socat' AND process.command_line contains 'UDP-Listen' AND process.command_line contains 'fork' AND process.command_line contains 'EXEC' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: Spooler Service Creating or Spawning Executables
signals.description: Detects when the Windows Spooler Service process launches another process or creates an executable.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\spoolsv.exe' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.exe')) OR (process.parent_path ends with '\\spoolsv.exe' AND process.path ends with '.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT 'werfault.exe' AND (process.path ends with NOT '\\regsvr32.exe' OR process.command_line contains NOT 'spool\\drivers'))
signals.id: Spooler Service Creating or Spawning Executables

signals.name: Suspicious HTA Execution
signals.description: Detects when rundll32 calls OpenURL as a trampoline for executing HTA files.
signals.text: (process.path contains 'mshta.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-embedding') OR (process.parent_path ends with 'rundll32.exe' AND process.path ends with 'mshta.exe') OR ((process.path ends with '\\rundll32.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.hta')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Suspicious JavaScript Execution
signals.description: Detects usage of the RUNDLL32.EXE or MSHTA.EXE utilities to execute JavaScript. Often used by "fileless" malware to dynamically pass and execute code at runtime.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'rundll32.exe' OR process.path contains 'mshta.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'javascript:'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Suspicious NTDSUtil Execution
signals.description: Detects the use of NTDSUtil to create a full backup of the ntds.dit file which along with the acquisition of the SYSTEM and SECURITY hives can be used to extract the password hashes offline.
signals.text: process.path contains 'ntdsutil' AND ((process.command_line contains 'ntds' AND (process.command_line contains 'activate' OR process.command_line contains 'ac') AND (process.command_line contains 'instance' OR process.command_line contains 'in') AND (process.command_line contains 'create' OR process.command_line contains 'cr') AND (process.command_line contains 'full' OR process.command_line contains 'fu')) OR group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path contains 'ntds.dit'))

signals.name: Suspicious Network Connections from Windows Processes
signals.description: Detects uncommon network connections to ports 80 or 443 initiated by native Windows processes that typically do not connect to these ports.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\certutil.exe') AND (network.port is '80' OR network.port is '443') AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\amazonAssistantService.exe'
signals.id: Suspicious Network Connections from Windows Processes

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line
signals.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter with command line arguments that are often used to load and run malicious code.
signals.text: ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (process.command_line contains 'wscript.shell' OR process.command_line contains 'FromBase64String' OR process.command_line contains 'WebRequest' OR process.command_line contains 'Sockets.TCPClient' OR (process.command_line contains 'Webclient' AND process.command_line contains 'http') OR (process.command_line contains 'IO' AND process.command_line contains 'Stream') OR (process.command_line contains 'encoding' AND process.command_line contains 'GetString') OR (process.command_line contains '-com' AND process.command_line contains 'transformNode') OR process.command_line contains 'Assembly.Load' OR process.command_line contains '^')) AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection\\SenseIR.exe' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\QualysAgent.exe'

signals.name: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line Encodeda
signals.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter with undocumented command line and the encodedarguments or encodeda arguments flag encodeda that can be used to obfuscate malicious code.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'encodeda'

signals.name: Suspicious PowerShell Launched by WMI
signals.description: Detect anomalous execution of PowerShell by the WMI hosting process (WMIPRVSE.EXE). This technique is often utilized in Office macro payloads.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (network.port is '80' OR network.port is '443') AND process.parent_path ends with '\\wmiprvse.exe' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\CCM' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\CCM'

signals.name: Suspicious PowerShell Process Ancestry
signals.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter by atypical parent processes. Office macro malware attacks often employ this technique. The signal looks for PowerShell spawned by the CSCRIPT.EXE, WSCRIPT.EXE, or MSHTA.EXE interpreters, as well as by the Microsoft Word or Excel applications, to cover both direct and indirect execution.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (process.parent_path ends with '\\wscript.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\cscript.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\excel.exe') AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'AnyConnect' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\Tanium\\Tanium Client\\Downloads\\Action' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\Tanium\\Tanium Client\\Patch\\'

signals.name: Suspicious System Management Automation Image Load
signals.description: Detects processes loading system.management.automation.dll (powershell) into unusual processes.
signals.text: image.path contains 'system.management.automation' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\mscorsvw.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\monitoringhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\powershell.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\powershell_ise.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\pwsh.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\sdiagnhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\servermanager.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\sqlps.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\wsmprovhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\miiserver.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\taniumclient.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\taniumcx.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\msiexec.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\Ssms.exe'
signals.id: Suspicious System Management Automation Image Load

signals.name: Suspicious VBScript Execution
signals.description: Detects usage of the RUNDLL32.EXE or MSHTA.EXE utilities to execute VBScript. Often used by fileless malware to dynamically pass and execute code at runtime.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'rundll32.exe' OR process.path ends with 'mshta.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'vbscript:'

Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic

signals.description: Detects the potential misuse of SyncAppVPublishingServer.exe for executing powershell.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\Syncappvpublishingserver.exe' AND process.command_line contains '"n;'

signals.name: SyncAppVPublishingServer VBS Powershell Execution
signals.description: Detects the potential misuse of SyncAppVPublishingServer.vbs for executing powershell.

signals.name: TCPDump Commands Privilege Escalation
signals.description: Detects common commands used with TCPDump to escalate privileges.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'tcpdump' AND process.command_line contains '-ln' AND process.command_line contains '-i' AND process.command_line contains 'lo' AND process.command_line contains '-W' AND process.command_line contains '-G' AND process.command_line contains '-z'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

signals.name: TTY Terminal Spawned via Python
signals.description: Detects a fully-interactive terminal TTY session that is spawned from Python.
signals.text: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains 'import pty' AND process.command_line contains 'pty.spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'sh' AND (file.path ends with 'pts' OR file.path ends with 'ptmx')

signals.name: Tracer Diagnostics Proxy Execution
signals.description: Detects when a subprocess is launched from tracer diagnostics, which can be used as a proxy launcher.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path contains 'tttracer.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Trusted Developer Utilities Proxy Execution
signals.description: There are several methods of compiling or executing code that are normally only executed by developers or build systems but also can be used by attackers to evade detection and gain execution.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\MSBuild.exe' AND (process.command_line contains '.xml' OR process.command_line contains '.csproj')) OR (process.path ends with '\\tracker.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/d') OR ((process.path ends with '\\rcsi.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\csi.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.csx') OR (process.path ends with '\\cdb.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-o') OR process.path ends with '\\dnx.exe'

techniques.name: Trusted Developer Utilities Proxy Execution: MSBuild

signals.description: Detects the execution of tscon.exe as system that can be used to hijack RDP sessions.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\tscon.exe' AND process.user_name contains 'SYSTEM'

techniques.name: Remote Service Session Hijacking: RDP Hijacking
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: UMWorkerProcess Spawned Processes
signals.description: This detects processes that are spawned by the UMWorkerProcess.  The UMWorkerProcess does not typically spawn child processes and may be a sign of process injection.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\UMWorkerProcess.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\werfault.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\wermgr.exe'

signals.name: Uncommon INF Script Execution
signals.description: Detects the uncommon use of INF script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
signals.text: (process.path contains 'cmstp.exe' OR process.path contains 'infdefaultinstall.exe') AND process.command_line contains '/s'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Uncommon RegSvcs & RegAsm Script Execution
signals.description: Detects the uncommon use of RegSvcs & RegAsm script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
signals.text: process.path contains '\\Windows\\Microsoft.NET\\Framework' AND process.command_line contains '.dll' AND (process.path ends with '\\RegSvcs.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\RegAsm.exe')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Uncommon SCT Script Execution
signals.description: Detects the uncommon use of SCT script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\iexpress.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/n' AND process.command_line contains '.sed') OR ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.sct') AND process.command_line contains NOT 'tanium.sed'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Uncommon XSL Script Execution
signals.description: Detects the uncommon use of XSL script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Binary
signals.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a binary on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.exe')

signals.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Driver
signals.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a driver on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.sys')

signals.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Library
signals.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a dynamic-link library on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.dll')

signals.name: Unsigned Process Creating a PowerShell Script
signals.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a PowerShell script file, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.ps1')
signals.id: Unsigned Process Creating a PowerShell Script

signals.name: Unsigned Process Modifying Files in Windows Directory
signals.description: Detects an unsigned processes modifying files in the windows system directory, which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND file.path contains ':\\windows\\'
signals.id: Unsigned Process Modifying Files in Windows Directory

signals.name: User Added to Local Administrators
signals.description: Detects usage of NET.EXE to add an account to the local Administrator users group.
signals.text: (process.path ends with '\\net.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\net1.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'localgroup administrators' AND process.command_line contains '/add' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Vim Launching an Executable from the Command Line
signals.description: Detects the potential use of vim to proxy another command. This can be used to breakout of restricted environments.

signals.id: Vim Launching an Executable from the Command Line

signals.name: Volume Shadow Copy Deletion
signals.description: Detects usage of the VSSADMIN.EXE or WMIC.EXE utilities to delete Volume Shadow Copies. Often used by ransomware to eliminate backed-up data, as well as by targeted attackers seeking to destroy evidence of prior activity.
signals.text: (process.path ends with 'wmic.exe' OR process.path ends with 'vssadmin.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'delete' AND process.command_line contains 'shadow'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Vssadmin Resize Volume Shadow Copy
signals.description: Detects usage of the VSssadmin.exe to resize the Volume Shadow Copies. This technique has been seen in ransomware to force deletion of shadow copies to eliminate backed-up data, as well as by attackers seeking to destroy evidence of prior activity.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'vssadmin.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'resize' AND process.command_line contains 'shadowstorage'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: WMI Managed Object Format Execution
signals.description: Windows managed object format can be used to create common information model classes which are compiled with mofcomp.exe. Attackers can use MOF files to configure backdoor persistence on systems.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\mofcomp.exe' AND process.command_line contains '.mof' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT 'MsMpEng.exe' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\Windows Defender\\'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: WMIC Process Creation

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Windows Session Enumeration pipelsarpc
signals.description: Detects artifacts related to windows session enumeration used by tools such as Bloodhound to collect information on user sessions.
signals.text: network.port is '445' AND group( file.operation is 'write' AND file.path ends with '\\pipe\\lsarpc' )

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Windows Telemetry Control Monitoring
signals.description: The Telemetry Control monitoring subsystem in Windows is designed to be extensible via the registry.  By registering a new subkey of HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController it executes any command line put in the command value.
signals.text: group(registry.key_path contains '\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\AppCompatFlags\\TelemetryController' AND registry.value_name is 'Command')

signals.name: Wininit Running as not System
signals.description: Detects when wininit.exe is running as something other than the system user, which could indicate attacker activity.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\wininit.exe' AND process.user_name is NOT 'SYSTEM'

techniques.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location

signals.name: Word Spawned Connection to Port 443
signals.description: Detects the connection to port 443 by a descendent process of Word which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\winword.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\winword.exe' AND network.port is '443'

signals.name: Word Spawned Connection to Port 80
signals.description: Detects the connection to port 80 by a descendent process of Word which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\winword.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\winword.exe' AND network.port is '80'

signals.name: Word Spawned Process Creating BAT Files
signals.description: Detects the creation of BAT files by Word or a descendent process which may be a sign of attack activity.
signals.text: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\winword.exe' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.bat')
signals.id: Word Spawned Process Creating BAT Files

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic

signals.name: XWizard Proxy Download
signals.description: Detects the use of XWizard.exe to proxy a download. This can be used as an AppLocker bypass to download attacker binaries.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\xwizard.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'Runwizard' AND process.command_line contains '/z' AND process.command_line contains 'http'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: XWizard Proxy Execution
signals.description: Detects the use of XWizard.exe for a potential proxy execution. This can be used as an AppLocker bypass or to execute arbitrary binaries.
signals.text: process.path ends with '\\xwizard.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'Runwizard' AND process.command_line contains '/taero' AND process.command_line contains '/u'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

signals.name: Zone Identifier ADS Deletion
signals.description: Detects deletion of Zone Identifier ADS files that may be related to attacker actvity to cover their tracks.
signals.text: group(file.path ends with ':Zone.Identifier' AND file.operation is 'delete')

techniques.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion

signals.name: Zsh Commands Reverse Shell
signals.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with zsh.
signals.text: process.path ends with 'zsh' AND process.command_line contains 'zmodload' AND process.command_line contains 'net' AND process.command_line contains 'tcp' AND process.command_line contains 'REPLY'
